news.title: Netflix to buy Warner Bros film and streaming businesses for $72bn
news.summary: The major Hollywood deal means Netflix will takeover ownership of franchises including Harry Potter and Game of Thrones.

news.title: Germany votes to bring in voluntary military service programme for 18-year-olds
news.summary: The shift in its approach to its military follows a push to create Europe's strongest conventional army.

news.title: 'I don't want to be part of this war machine': Young Germans protest against military service plans
news.summary: Young people have taken to the streets of Berlin to protest against the German parliament's decision to introduce voluntary military service to boost national defences after Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

news.title: Doctor charged with sex assaults of 38 patients
news.summary: The charges against Nathaniel Spencer relate to his time working at two West Midlands hospitals.

news.title: Catherine's Christmas carol concert honours charity helpers
news.summary: The concert will also feature readings from actors including Kate Winslet and Chiwetel Ejiofor.

news.title: Kim Cattrall marries fianc√© she met on BBC radio show
news.summary: The actress met Russell Thomas when he was working at the BBC and she was a guest on Radio 4 in 2016.

news.title: Man, 18, struck on motorway Tasered before death
news.summary: Logan Smith, 18, died after getting out of an ambulance on the M5 on Sunday evening.

news.title: Irish police investigating drone activity during Zelensky visit
news.summary: The Irish police force says it is investigating the matter after reports of drones near Dublin around the time the Ukrainian president landed.

news.title: US hits out at EU's 'suffocating regulations' after it fines Elon Musk's X
news.summary: The European Commission says the social media site is opening its users up to scams and impersonations.

news.title: LGBT survivors tell of 'barbaric' NHS shock therapy
news.summary: More than 250 people were subjected to painful electric shocks in NHS hospitals, the BBC discovers.
